name: Citrus Marinated Pork Chops
ingredients: 1 ½ Tbl balsamic vinegar 1 Tbl plus 1 tsp olive oil
1 Tbl Dijon mustard 4 center-­‐cut pork chops 1 inch thick
2 to 3 garlic cloves 1 Tbl unsalted butter
2 to 3 sprigs thyme or ½ tsp dried thyme
steps: Juice of 2 limes ½ tsp coarse salt
Juice of 2 oranges ½ tsp freshly ground pepper
In large nonreactive bowl, combine all ingredients except 1 tsp olive oil, pork chops and butter, mix well.
Add chops and spoon marinade over them to coat. Marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Heat a heavy skillet over med. Heat for 2 minutes. Remove chops from marinade, reserving marinade. Brush
pan with the remaining tsp oil; cook, covered for 7 minutes, turning chops once.
Remove chops from pan and set aside. Raise heat to med-­‐high reduce liquid until thick. Remove from heat and
stir in butter. Pour sauce over chops and serve.
Bottle of Hickory flavored liquid smoke
Place in a large roasting pan. Pour an entire bottle of Hickory flavored liquid smoke over the roast and then
rub salt and pepper into the meat. Cover with heavy duty foil and cook it at 250 degrees for about 8 hours
and then 275 degrees for about 4-­‐5 more hours. After that it just falls apart and feeds a lot.
I cooked 3 20-­‐lb roasts for the boys and every last morsel was gone.
